ygData.subject: Re: Tongues, blue cons, and etiquette
ygData.msgSnippet: Interesting! Can anyone else confirm that hide/sneak is similar to invi/camo? That makes sense to me, especially if see invis lets you see hidding/sneaking
ygData.messageBody:
Interesting! Can anyone else confirm that
hide/sneak is similar to invi/camo? That makes sense to me,
especially if see invis lets you see hidding/sneaking PCs.
<br><br>When you're sitting in "hide" mode, i've noticed that
some animals who KOS you will see through the hide.
(they must be able to smell me!!) This is not true when
sitting invis/camo, as far as I know. I have not had an
animal see through my invis - in fact, last night i was
inches from Grimfeather the griffen, while camo, and he
/conned indiff and ignored me. I have noticed that
casters (ie. orc oracles and derv casters) will see
through my hide, and send their buddies after me. This is
less true (IME - in my experience) with camo, though
it happens.<br><br>/con is ALWAYS the rule to be
sure. Indiff is a good thing, especially when it comes
to Griffs!! <br><br>P.S.-- i'll get the /con guide
and print what it says about levels of green-ness,
blue-ness, etc.<br><br>Xela
